welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content: # Welcome! Welcome to the discord.js v11.5 documentation. The v11.5 release contains bugfixes from v11.4 and backports features from the in-development v12. v12 is still very much a work-in-progress, as we're aiming to make it the best it can possibly be before releasing. If you are fond of living life on the bleeding-edge, check out the master branch. ## About discord.js is a powerful [Node.js](https://nodejs.org) module that allows you to interact with the [Discord API](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/intro) very easily. - Object-oriented - Predictable abstractions - Performant - 100% coverage of the Discord API ## Installation **Node.js 6.0.0 or newer is required.** Ignore any warnings about unmet peer dependencies, as they're all optional. Without voice support: `npm install discord.js` With voice support ([node-opus](https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-opus)): `npm install discord.js node-opus` With voice support ([opusscript](https://www.npmjs.com/package/opusscript)): `npm install discord.js opusscript` ### Audio engines The preferred audio engine is node-opus, as it performs significantly better than opusscript. When both are available, discord.js will automatically choose node-opus. Using opusscript is only recommended for development environments where node-opus is tough to get working. For production bots, using node-opus should be considered a necessity, especially if they're going to be running on multiple servers. ### Optional packages - [bufferutil](https://www.npmjs.com/package/bufferutil) to greatly speed up the WebSocket when *not* using uws (`npm install bufferutil`) - [erlpack](https://github.com/hammerandchisel/erlpack) for significantly faster WebSocket data (de)serialisation (`npm install hammerandchisel/erlpack`) - One of the following packages can be installed for faster voice packet encryption and decryption: - [sodium](https://www.npmjs.com/package/sodium) (`npm install sodium`) - [libsodium.js](https://www.npmjs.com/package/libsodium-wrappers) (`npm install libsodium-wrappers`) - [uws](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@discordjs/uws) for a much faster WebSocket connection (`npm install @discordjs/uws`) ## Example usage ```js const Discord = require('discord.js'); const client = new Discord.Client(); client.on('ready', () => { console.log(`Logged in as ${client.user.tag}!`); }); client.on('message', msg => { if (msg.content === 'ping') { msg.reply('pong'); } }); client.login('token'); ``` ## Links * [Website](https://discord.js.org/) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/website)) * [Documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs) * [Guide](https://discordjs.guide/) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/guide)) * [Discord.js Discord server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9) * [Discord API Discord server](https://discord.gg/discord-api) * [GitHub](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js) * [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) * [Related libraries](https://discordapi.com/unofficial/libs.html) ### Extensions * [RPC](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord-rpc) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/RPC)) ## Contributing Before creating an issue, please ensure that it hasn't already been reported/suggested, and double-check the [documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs). See [the contribution guide](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) if you'd like to submit a PR. ## Help If you don't understand something in the documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [Discord.js Server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9).

updating.name: Updating your code
updating.content:
# Version 11.5.0
v11.5.0 backports new features from the in-development v12, and fixes bugs in the v11.4.x releases.
See [the changelog](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/releases/tag/11.5.0) for a full list of changes, including information about deprecations.

# Version 11.4.0
v11.4.0 backports many new features such as Rich Presence and bugfixes from v11.3.0.
See [the changelog](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/releases/tag/11.4.0) for a full list of changes, including information about deprecations.

# Version 11.3.0
v11.3.0 backports many new features and bug fixes from the in-development v12.
See [the changelog](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/releases/tag/11.3.0) for a full list of changes, including information about deprecations.

# Version 11.2.0
v11.2.0 fixes a lot of bugs we encountered along the 11.1.0 release, as well as support for new features such as Message Attachments and UserGuildSettings.
See [the changelog](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/releases/tag/11.2.0) for a full list of changes, including information about deprecations.

# Version 11.1.0
v11.1.0 features improved voice and gateway stability, as well as support for new features such as audit logs and searching for messages.
See [the changelog](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/releases/tag/11.1.0) for a full list of changes, including
information about deprecations.

# Version 11
Version 11 contains loads of new and improved features, optimisations, and bug fixes.
See [the changelog](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/releases/tag/11.0.0) for a full list of changes.

## Significant additions
* Message Reactions and Embeds (rich text)
* Support for uws and erlpack for better performance
* OAuthApplication support
* Web distributions

## Breaking changes
### Client.login() no longer supports logging in with email + password
Logging in with an email and password has always been heavily discouraged since the advent of proper token support, but in v11 we have made the decision to completely remove the functionality, since Hammer & Chisel have [officially stated](https://github.com/hammerandchisel/discord-api-docs/issues/69#issuecomment-223886862) it simply shouldn't be done.

User accounts can still log in with tokens just like bot accounts. To obtain the token for a user account, you can log in to Discord with that account, and use Ctrl + Shift + I to open the developer tools. In the console tab, evaluating `localStorage.token` will give you the token for that account.

### ClientUser.setEmail()/setPassword() now require the current password, as well as setUsername() on user accounts
Since you can no longer log in with email and password, you must provide the current account password to the `setEmail()`, `setPassword()`, and `setUsername()` methods for user accounts (self-bots).

### Removed TextBasedChannel.sendTTSMessage()
This method was deemed to be an entirely pointless shortcut that virtually nobody even used.
The same results can be achieved by passing options to `send()` or `sendMessage()`.

Example:
```js
channel.send('Hi there', { tts: true });
```

### Using Collection.find()/exists() with IDs will throw an error
This is simply to help prevent a common mistake that is made frequently.
To find something or check its existence using an ID, you should use `.get()` and `.has()` which are part of the [ES6 Map class](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map), which Collection is an extension of.

# Version 10
Version 10's non-BC changes focus on cleaning up some inconsistencies that exist in previous versions.
Upgrading from v9 should be quick and painless.

## Client options
All client options have been converted to camelCase rather than snake_case, and `max_message_cache` was renamed to `messageCacheMaxSize`.

v9 code example:
```js
const client = new Discord.Client({
  disable_everyone: true,
  max_message_cache: 500,
  message_cache_lifetime: 120,
  message_sweep_interval: 60
});
```

v10 code example:
```js
const client = new Discord.Client({
  disableEveryone: true,
  messageCacheMaxSize: 500,
  messageCacheLifetime: 120,
  messageSweepInterval: 60
});
```

## Presences
Presences have been completely restructured.
Previous versions of discord.js assumed that users had the same presence amongst all guilds - with the introduction of sharding, however, this is no longer the case.

v9 discord.js code may look something like this:
```js
User.status; // the status of the user
User.game; // the game that the user is playing
ClientUser.setStatus(status, game, url); // set the new status for the user
```

v10 moves presences to GuildMember instances. For the sake of simplicity, though, User classes also expose presences.
When accessing a presence on a User object, it simply finds the first GuildMember for the user, and uses its presence.
Additionally, the introduction of the Presence class keeps all of the presence data organised.

**It is strongly recommended that you use a GuildMember's presence where available, rather than a User.
A user may have an entirely different presence between two different guilds.**

v10 code:
```js
MemberOrUser.presence.status; // the status of the member or user
MemberOrUser.presence.game; // the game that the member or user is playing
ClientUser.setStatus(status); // online, idle, dnd, offline
ClientUser.setGame(game, streamingURL); // a game
ClientUser.setPresence(fullPresence); // status and game combined
```

## Voice
Voice has been rewritten internally, but in a backwards-compatible manner.
There is only one breaking change here; the `disconnected` event was renamed to `disconnect`.
Several more events have been made available to a VoiceConnection, so see the documentation.

## Events
Many events have been renamed or had their arguments change.

### Client events
|    Version   9                                       |    Version   10                               |
|------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------|
|    guildMemberAdd(guild, member)                     |    guildMemberAdd(member)                     |
|    guildMemberAvailable(guild, member)               |    guildMemberAvailable(member)               |
|    guildMemberRemove(guild, member)                  |    guildMemberRemove(member)                  |
|    guildMembersChunk(guild, members)                 |    guildMembersChunk(members)                 |
|    guildMemberUpdate(guild, oldMember, newMember)    |    guildMemberUpdate(oldMember, newMember)    |
|    guildRoleCreate(guild, role)                      |    roleCreate(role)                           |
|    guildRoleDelete(guild, role)                      |    roleDelete(role)                           |
|    guildRoleUpdate(guild, oldRole, newRole)          |    roleUpdate(oldRole, newRole)               |

The guild parameter that has been dropped from the guild-related events can still be derived using `member.guild` or `role.guild`.

### VoiceConnection events
| Version 9    | Version 10 |
|--------------|------------|
| disconnected | disconnect |

## Dates and timestamps
All dates/timestamps on the structures have been refactored to have a consistent naming scheme and availability.
All of them are named similarly to this:
**Date:** `Message.createdAt`
**Timestamp:** `Message.createdTimestamp`
See the docs for each structure to see which date/timestamps are available on them.


# Version 9
The version 9 (v9) rewrite takes a much more object-oriented approach than previous versions,
which allows your code to be much more readable and manageable.
It's been rebuilt from the ground up and should be much more stable, fixing caching issues that affected
older versions. It also has support for newer Discord Features, such as emojis.

Version 9, while containing a sizable number of breaking changes, does not require much change in your code's logic -
most of the concepts are still the same, but loads of functions have been moved around.
The vast majority of methods you're used to using have been moved out of the Client class,
into other more relevant classes where they belong.
Because of this, you will need to convert most of your calls over to the new methods.

Here are a few examples of methods that have changed:
* `Client.sendMessage(channel, message)` ==> `TextChannel.sendMessage(message)`
  * `Client.sendMessage(user, message)` ==> `User.sendMessage(message)`
* `Client.updateMessage(message, "New content")` ==> `Message.edit("New Content")`
* `Client.getChannelLogs(channel, limit)` ==> `TextChannel.fetchMessages({options})`
* `Server.detailsOfUser(User)` ==> `Server.members.get(User).properties` (retrieving a member gives a GuildMember object)
* `Client.joinVoiceChannel(voicechannel)` => `VoiceChannel.join()`

A couple more important details:
* `Client.loginWithToken("token")` ==> `client.login("token")`
* `Client.servers.length` ==> `client.guilds.size` (all instances of `server` are now `guild`)

## No more callbacks!
Version 9 eschews callbacks in favour of Promises. This means all code relying on callbacks must be changed.
For example, the following code:

```js
client.getChannelLogs(channel, 100, function(messages) {
  console.log(`${messages.length} messages found`);
});
```

```js
channel.fetchMessages({limit: 100}).then(messages => {
  console.log(`${messages.size} messages found`);
});
```

faq.name: FAQ
faq.content:
# Frequently Asked Questions
These are just questions that get asked frequently, that usually have a common resolution.
If you have issues not listed here, please ask in the [official Discord server](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9).
Always make sure to read the documentation.

## No matter what, I get `SyntaxError: Block-scoped declarations (let, const, function, class) not yet supported outside strict mode`â€½
Update to Node.js 6.0.0 or newer.

## How do I get voice working?
- Install FFMPEG.
- Install either the `node-opus` package or the `opusscript` package.
  node-opus is greatly preferred, due to it having significantly better performance.

## How do I install FFMPEG?
- **npm:** `npm install ffmpeg-binaries`
- **Ubuntu 16.04:** `sudo apt install ffmpeg`
- **Ubuntu 14.04:** `sudo apt-get install libav-tools`
- **Windows:** `npm install ffmpeg-binaries` or see the [FFMPEG section of AoDude's guide](https://github.com/bdistin/OhGodMusicBot/blob/master/README.md#download-ffmpeg).

## How do I set up node-opus?
- **Ubuntu:** Simply run `npm install node-opus`, and it's done. Congrats!
- **Windows:** Run `npm install --global --production windows-build-tools` in an admin command prompt or PowerShell.
  Then, running `npm install node-opus` in your bot's directory should successfully build it. Woo!

web.name: Web builds
web.content:
# Web builds
In addition to your usual Node applications, discord.js has special distributions available that are capable of running in web browsers.
This is useful for client-side web apps that need to interact with the Discord API.
[Webpack 3](https://webpack.js.org/) is used to build these.

## Usage
You can obtain your desired version of discord.js' web build from the [webpack branch](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/tree/webpack) of the GitHub repository.
There is a file for each branch and version of the library, and the ones ending in `.min.js` are minified to substantially reduce the size of the source code.

Include the file on the page just as you would any other JS library, like so:
```html
<script type="text/javascript" src="discord.VERSION.min.js"></script>
```

Rather than importing discord.js with `require('discord.js')`, the entire `Discord` object is available as a global (on the `window`) object.
The usage of the API isn't any different from using it in Node.js.

## Restrictions
- Any voice-related functionality is unavailable, as there is currently no audio encoding/decoding capabilities without external native libraries,
  which web browsers do not support.
- The ShardingManager cannot be used, since it relies on being able to spawn child processes for shards.
- None of the optional packages are usable, since they're native libraries.

## Example
```html
<script type="text/javascript" src="discord.11.5.0.min.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
  const client = new Discord.Client();

  client.on('message', msg => {
    const guildTag = msg.channel.type === 'text' ? `[${msg.guild.name}]` : '[DM]';
    const channelTag = msg.channel.type === 'text' ? `[#${msg.channel.name}]` : '';
    console.log(`${guildTag}${channelTag} ${msg.author.tag}: ${msg.content}`);
  });

  client.login('some crazy token');
</script>
```

ping.name: Ping

avatars.name: Avatars

attachments.name: Attachments

greeting.name: Server greeting

embed.name: Message Embed

moderation.name: Moderation

webhook.name: Webhook

classes.name: Client
classes.description: The main hub for interacting with the Discord API, and the starting point for any bot.

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: dataManager
props.description: The data manager of the client

props.name: manager
props.description: The manager of the client

props.name: ws
props.description: The WebSocket manager of the client

props.name: resolver
props.description: The data resolver of the client

props.name: actions
props.description: The action manager of the client

props.name: voice
props.description: The voice manager of the client (`null` in browsers)

props.name: shard
props.description:
The shard helpers for the client
(only if the process was spawned as a child, such as from a {@link ShardingManager})

props.name: users
props.description: All of the {@link User} objects that have been cached at any point, mapped by their IDs

props.name: guilds
props.description:
All of the guilds the client is currently handling, mapped by their IDs -
as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* guild the bot is a member of

props.name: channels
props.description:
All of the {@link Channel}s that the client is currently handling, mapped by their IDs -
as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* channel in *every* guild, and all DM channels

props.name: presences
props.description:
Presences that have been received for the client user's friends, mapped by user IDs
<warn>This is only filled when using a user account.</warn>

props.name: token
props.description:
Authorization token for the logged in user/bot
<warn>This should be kept private at all times.</warn>

props.name: user
props.description: User that the client is logged in as

props.name: readyAt
props.description:
Time at which the client was last regarded as being in the `READY` state
(each time the client disconnects and successfully reconnects, this will be overwritten)

props.name: broadcasts
props.description: Active voice broadcasts that have been created

props.name: pings
props.description: Previous heartbeat pings of the websocket (most recent first, limited to three elements)

props.name: _timeouts
props.description: Timeouts set by {@link Client#setTimeout} that are still active

props.name: _intervals
props.description: Intervals set by {@link Client#setInterval} that are still active

props.name: _pingTimestamp
props.description: Timestamp of the latest ping's start time

props.name: status
props.description: Current status of the client's connection to Discord

props.name: uptime
props.description: How long it has been since the client last entered the `READY` state in milliseconds

props.name: ping
props.description: Average heartbeat ping of the websocket, obtained by averaging the {@link Client#pings} property

props.name: voiceConnections
props.description: All active voice connections that have been established, mapped by guild ID

props.name: emojis
props.description: All custom emojis that the client has access to, mapped by their IDs

props.name: readyTimestamp
props.description: Timestamp of the time the client was last `READY` at

props.name: browser
props.description: Whether the client is in a browser environment

methods.name: createVoiceBroadcast
methods.description: Creates a voice broadcast.

methods.name: login
methods.description:
Logs the client in, establishing a websocket connection to Discord.
<info>Both bot and regular user accounts are supported, but it is highly recommended to use a bot account whenever
possible. User accounts are subject to harsher ratelimits and other restrictions that don't apply to bot accounts.
Bot accounts also have access to many features that user accounts cannot utilise. Automating a user account is
considered a violation of the ToS.</info>

params.name: token
params.description: Token of the account to log in with

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Logs out, terminates the connection to Discord, and destroys the client.

methods.name: syncGuilds
methods.description:
Requests a sync of guild data with Discord.
<info>This can be done automatically every 30 seconds by enabling {@link ClientOptions#sync}.</info>
<warn>This is only available when using a user account.</warn>

params.name: guilds
params.description: An array or collection of guilds to sync

methods.name: fetchUser
methods.description:
Obtains a user from Discord, or the user cache if it's already available.
<warn>This is only available when using a bot account.</warn>

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether to cache the new user object if it isn't already

methods.name: fetchInvite
methods.description: Obtains an invite from Discord.

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Obtains a webhook from Discord.

methods.name: fetchVoiceRegions
methods.description: Obtains the available voice regions from Discord.

methods.name: sweepMessages
methods.description:
Sweeps all text-based channels' messages and removes the ones older than the max message lifetime.
If the message has been edited, the time of the edit is used rather than the time of the original message.

params.name: lifetime
params.description:
Messages that are older than this (in seconds)
will be removed from the caches. The default is based on {@link ClientOptions#messageCacheLifetime}

returns.description:
Amount of messages that were removed from the caches,
or -1 if the message cache lifetime is unlimited

methods.name: fetchApplication
methods.description:
Obtains the OAuth Application of the bot from Discord.
<warn>Bots can only fetch their own profile.</warn>

methods.name: generateInvite
methods.description:
Generates a link that can be used to invite the bot to a guild.
<warn>This is only available when using a bot account.</warn>

methods.name: setTimeout
methods.description: Sets a timeout that will be automatically cancelled if the client is destroyed.

params.name: delay
params.description: Time to wait before executing (in milliseconds)

methods.name: clearTimeout
methods.description: Clears a timeout.

methods.name: setInterval
methods.description: Sets an interval that will be automatically cancelled if the client is destroyed.

params.name: delay
params.description: Time to wait before executing (in milliseconds)

methods.name: clearInterval
methods.description: Clears an interval.

methods.name: _pong
methods.description: Adds a ping to {@link Client#pings}.

methods.name: _setPresence
methods.description: Adds/updates a friend's presence in {@link Client#presences}.

methods.name: _eval
methods.description:
Calls {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/eval} on a script
with the client as `this`.

methods.name: _validateOptions
methods.description: Validates the client options.

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change.

events.name: guildUnavailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes unavailable, likely due to a server outage.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that has become unavailable

events.name: emojiCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is created in a guild.

events.name: emojiDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom guild emoji is deleted.

events.name: emojiUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom guild emoji is updated.

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has left/been kicked from the guild

events.name: roleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a role is created.

events.name: roleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

events.name: roleUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

events.name: messageReactionAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is added to a cached message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that applied the emoji or reaction emoji

events.name: messageReactionRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is removed from a cached message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user whose emoji or reaction emoji was removed

events.name: messageReactionRemoveAll
events.description: Emitted whenever all reactions are removed from a cached message.

params.name: message
params.description: The message the reactions were removed from

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

events.name: userNoteUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a note is updated.

params.name: user
params.description: The user the note belongs to

params.name: oldNote
params.description: The note content before the update

params.name: newNote
params.description: The note content after the update

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted for general warnings.

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted for general debugging information.

events.name: guildCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client joins a guild.

events.name: rateLimit
events.description: Emitted when the client hits a rate limit while making a request

params.name: rateLimitInfo
params.description: Object containing the rate limit info

params.name: rateLimitInfo.limit
params.description: Number of requests that can be made to this endpoint

params.name: rateLimitInfo.timeDifference
params.description: Delta-T in ms between your system and Discord servers

params.name: rateLimitInfo.path
params.description: Path used for request that triggered this event

params.name: rateLimitInfo.method
params.description: HTTP method used for request that triggered this event

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is created.

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is deleted.

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever the pins of a channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event, not much information
can be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.
<warn>The `time` parameter will be a Unix Epoch Date object when there are no pins left.</warn>

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occured in

params.name: time
params.description: The time when the last pinned message was pinned

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the ban occurred in

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that the unban occurred in

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is deleted/left.

events.name: guildIntegrationsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild integration is updated

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild whose integrations were updated

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of guild members is received (all members come from the same guild).

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild related to the member chunk

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created.

events.name: messageDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is deleted.

events.name: messageDeleteBulk
events.description: Emitted whenever messages are deleted in bulk.

params.name: messages
params.description: The deleted messages, mapped by their ID

events.name: presenceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild member's presence changes, or they change one of their details.

params.name: oldMember
params.description: The member before the presence update

params.name: newMember
params.description: The member after the presence update

events.name: userUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user's details (e.g. username) are changed.

events.name: guildMemberAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a member becomes available in a large guild.

events.name: resume
events.description: Emitted whenever a WebSocket resumes.

params.name: replayed
params.description: The number of events that were replayed

events.name: typingStart
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts typing in a channel.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user started typing in

events.name: typingStop
events.description: Emitted whenever a user stops typing in a channel.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user stopped typing in

events.name: clientUserGuildSettingsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client user's settings update.

params.name: clientUserGuildSettings
params.description: The new client user guild settings

events.name: clientUserSettingsUpdate
events.description: Emitted when the client user's settings update.

events.name: voiceStateUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a user changes voice state - e.g. joins/leaves a channel, mutes/unmutes.

params.name: oldMember

methods.description:
Creates a readable stream for a user that provides PCM data while the user is speaking. When the user
stops speaking, the stream is destroyed. The stream is 32-bit signed stereo PCM at 48KHz.

params.description: The user to create the stream for

events.description: Emitted whenever a voice packet experiences a problem.

The reason for the warning. If it happened because the voice packet could not be
decrypted, this would be `decrypt`. If it happened because the voice packet could not be decoded into
PCM, this would be `decode`

events.description: Emitted whenever voice data is received from the voice connection. This is _always_ emitted (unlike PCM).

params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

events.description:
Emits decoded voice data when it's received. For performance reasons, the decoding will only
happen if there is at least one `pcm` listener on this receiver.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that is sending the buffer (is speaking)

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description:
This is a utility class that can be used to help you spawn shards of your client. Each shard is completely separate
from the other. The Shard Manager takes a path to a file and spawns it under the specified amount of shards safely.
If you do not select an amount of shards, the manager will automatically decide the best amount.

params.name: file
params.description: Path to your shard script file

params.name: options.totalShards
params.description: Number of shards to spawn, or "auto"

params.name: options.respawn
params.description: Whether shards should automatically respawn upon exiting

params.name: options.shardArgs
params.description: Arguments to pass to the shard script when spawning

params.name: options.token
params.description: Token to use for automatic shard count and passing to shards

props.name: file

props.name: execArgv
props.description: Arguments for the shard's process executable

props.name: token
props.description: Token to use for obtaining the automatic shard count, and passing to shards

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned

Stops the typing indicator in the channel.

<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>

classes.name: Guild

params.description: Whether to clone the channel with this channel's permission overwrites

params.name: withTopic
params.description: Whether to clone the channel with this channel's topic

methods.name: fetchInvites
methods.description:
Fetches a collection of invites to this guild channel.
Resolves with a collection mapping invites by their codes.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this channel.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this channel has the same type, topic, position, name, overwrites and ID as another channel.
In most cases, a simple `channel.id === channel2.id` will do, and is much faster too.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the channel's mention instead of the Channel object.
examples:

// Logs: Hello from <#123456789012345678>

classes.name: Invite

Represents an invitation to a guild channel.
<warn>The only guaranteed properties are `code`, `url`, `guild`, and `channel`.
Other properties can be missing.</warn>

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated the invite

The guild the invite is for. If this guild is already known, this will be a guild object. If the guild is
unknown, this will be a PartialGuild object

props.name: presenceCount

props.name: voiceChannelCount
props.description: The number of voice channels the guild this invite goes to has

props.name: temporary
props.description: Whether or not this invite is temporary

props.name: maxAge
props.description: The maximum age of the invite, in seconds

props.name: uses
props.description: How many times this invite has been used

props.name: maxUses
props.description: The maximum uses of this invite

props.name: inviter
props.description: The user who created this invite

props.name: channel
props.description:
The channel the invite is for. If this channel is already known, this will be a GuildChannel object.
If the channel is unknown, this will be a PartialGuildChannel object.

props.description: The timestamp the invite was created at

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the invite was created

props.name: expiresTimestamp

methods.description: Deletes this invite.

classes.name: Message

props.description:

If mentions cannot be resolved to a name, the relevant mention in the message content will not be converted.

An array of cached versions of the message, including the current version
Sorted from latest (first) to oldest (last)

props.description: Whether the message is editable by the client user

props.name: deletable
props.description: Whether the message is deletable by the client user

props.name: pinnable
props.description: Whether the message is pinnable by the client user

methods.description: Updates the message.

methods.description: Creates a reaction collector.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to send to the collector

methods.description:
Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.
Resolves with a collection of reactions that pass the specified filter.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: isMentioned
methods.description: Whether or not a user, channel or role is mentioned in this message.

params.name: data
params.description:
Either a guild channel, user or a role object, or a string representing
the ID of any of these

methods.description:
Whether or not a guild member is mentioned in this message. Takes into account
user mentions, role mentions, and @everyone/@here mentions.

params.description: The member/user to check for a mention of

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edit the content of the message.

params.name: content
params.description: The new content for the message

methods.name: editCode
methods.description: Edit the content of the message, with a code block.

params.name: lang
params.description: The language for the code block

params.name: content
params.description: The new content for the message

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Pins this message to the channel's pinned messages.

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Unpins this message from the channel's pinned messages.

methods.name: react
methods.description: Add a reaction to the message.

methods.name: clearReactions
methods.description: Remove all reactions from a message.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the message.

params.name: timeout
params.description: How long to wait to delete the message in milliseconds

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Reply to the message.

methods.name: acknowledge
methods.description:
Marks the message as read.
<warn>This is only available when using a user account.</warn>

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Fetches the webhook used to create this message.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messages
without checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. This
method allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the message's content instead of the object.
examples:
// Logs: Message: This is a message!
console.log(`Message: ${message}`);

Those need to be fetched separately in such a case.</info>

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// Start typing in a channel
channel.startTyping();

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// Reduce the typing count by one and stop typing if it reached 0
channel.stopTyping();

// Force typing to fully stop in a channel
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

classes.name: Collection
classes.description:
A Map with additional utility methods. This is used throughout discord.js rather than Arrays for anything that has
an ID, for significantly improved performance and ease-of-use.

props.name: _array
props.description: Cached array for the `array()` method - will be reset to `null` whenever `set()` or `delete()` are called

props.name: _keyArray
props.description: Cached array for the `keyArray()` method - will be reset to `null` whenever `set()` or `delete()` are called

methods.name: array
methods.description:
Creates an ordered array of the values of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only be
reconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you change the length of the array
itself. If you don't want this caching behavior, use `[...collection.values()]` or
`Array.from(collection.values())` instead.

methods.name: keyArray
methods.description:
Creates an ordered array of the keys of this collection, and caches it internally. The array will only be
reconstructed if an item is added to or removed from the collection, or if you change the length of the array
itself. If you don't want this caching behavior, use `[...collection.keys()]` or
`Array.from(collection.keys())` instead.

methods.name: first
methods.description: Obtains the first value(s) in this collection.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of values to obtain from the beginning

returns.description: The single value if `count` is undefined, or an array of values of `count` length

methods.name: firstKey
methods.description: Obtains the first key(s) in this collection.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of keys to obtain from the beginning

returns.description: The single key if `count` is undefined, or an array of keys of `count` length

methods.name: last
methods.description:
Obtains the last value(s) in this collection. This relies on {@link Collection#array}, and thus the caching
mechanism applies here as well.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of values to obtain from the end

returns.description: The single value if `count` is undefined, or an array of values of `count` length

methods.name: lastKey
methods.description:
Obtains the last key(s) in this collection. This relies on {@link Collection#keyArray}, and thus the caching
mechanism applies here as well.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of keys to obtain from the end

returns.description: The single key if `count` is undefined, or an array of keys of `count` length

methods.name: random
methods.description:
Obtains random value(s) from this collection. This relies on {@link Collection#array}, and thus the caching
mechanism applies here as well.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of values to obtain randomly

returns.description: The single value if `count` is undefined, or an array of values of `count` length

methods.name: randomKey
methods.description:
Obtains random key(s) from this collection. This relies on {@link Collection#keyArray}, and thus the caching
mechanism applies here as well.

params.name: count
params.description: Number of keys to obtain randomly

returns.description: The single key if `count` is undefined, or an array of keys of `count` length

methods.name: findAll
methods.description:
Searches for all items where their specified property's value is identical to the given value
(`item[prop] === value`).
examples: collection.findAll('username', 'Bob');

methods.name: find
methods.description:
Searches for a single item where its specified property's value is identical to the given value
(`item[prop] === value`), or the given function returns a truthy value. In the latter case, this is identical to
[Array.find()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/find).
<warn>All collections used in Discord.js are mapped using their `id` property, and if you want to find by id you
should use the `get` method. See
[MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/get) for details.</warn>
examples: collection.find('username', 'Bob');
collection.find(val => val.username === 'Bob');

params.name: propOrFn
params.description: The property to test against, or the function to test with

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value - only applicable and required if using a property for the first argument

methods.name: findKey
methods.description:
Searches for the key of a single item where its specified property's value is identical to the given value
(`item[prop] === value`), or the given function returns a truthy value. In the latter case, this is identical to
[Array.findIndex()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/findIndex).
examples: collection.findKey('username', 'Bob');
collection.findKey(val => val.username === 'Bob');

params.name: propOrFn
params.description: The property to test against, or the function to test with

params.name: value
params.description: The expected value - only applicable and required if using a property for the first argument

methods.name: exists
methods.description:
Searches for the existence of a single item where its specified property's value is identical to the given value
(`item[prop] === value`).
<warn>Do not use this to check for an item by its ID. Instead, use `collection.has(id)`. See
[MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/has) for details.</warn>

methods.name: sweep
methods.description: Removes entries that satisfy the provided filter function.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: filter
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter),
but returns a Collection instead of an Array.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: filterArray
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.filter()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: partition
methods.description:
Partitions the collection into two collections where the first collection
contains the items that passed and the second contains the items that failed.
examples: const [big, small] = collection.partition(guild => guild.memberCount > 250);

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: map
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.map()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/map).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function that produces an element of the new array, taking three arguments

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: some
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.some()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/some).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: every
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.every()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/every).

params.name: fn
params.description: Function used to test (should return a boolean)

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: reduce
methods.description:
Identical to
[Array.reduce()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/reduce).

params.name: fn
params.description:
Function used to reduce, taking four arguments; `accumulator`, `currentValue`, `currentKey`,
and `collection`

methods.name: tap
methods.description:
Identical to
[Map.forEach()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/forEach),
but returns the collection instead of undefined.
examples:
collection
 .tap(user => console.log(user.username))
 .filter(user => user.bot)
 .tap(user => console.log(user.username));

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to execute for each element

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as `this` when executing function

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates an identical shallow copy of this collection.
examples: const newColl = someColl.clone();

methods.name: concat
methods.description: Combines this collection with others into a new collection. None of the source collections are modified.
examples: const newColl = someColl.concat(someOtherColl, anotherColl, ohBoyAColl);

methods.name: deleteAll
methods.description: Calls the `delete()` method on all items that have it.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Checks if this collection shares identical key-value pairings with another.
This is different to checking for equality using equal-signs, because
the collections may be different objects, but contain the same data.

returns.description: Whether the collections have identical contents

methods.name: sort
methods.description:
The sort() method sorts the elements of a collection in place and returns the collection.
The sort is not necessarily stable. The default sort order is according to string Unicode code points.

params.name: compareFunction

classes.name: Permissions
classes.description:
Data structure that makes it easy to interact with a permission bitfield. All {@link GuildMember}s have a set of
permissions in their guild, and each channel in the guild may also have {@link PermissionOverwrites} for the member
that override their default permissions.

params.name: permissions
params.description: Permissions or bitfield to read from

props.name: _member
props.description: Member the permissions are for

props.name: bitfield
props.description: Bitfield of the packed permissions

props.name: raw
props.description: Bitfield of the packed permissions

props.name: FLAGS
props.description:
Numeric permission flags. All available properties:
- `ADMINISTRATOR` (implicitly has *all* permissions, and bypasses all channel overwrites)
- `CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE` (create invitations to the guild)
- `KICK_MEMBERS`
- `BAN_MEMBERS`
- `MANAGE_CHANNELS` (edit and reorder channels)
- `MANAGE_GUILD` (edit the guild information, region, etc.)
- `ADD_REACTIONS` (add new reactions to messages)
- `VIEW_AUDIT_LOG`
- `PRIORITY_SPEAKER`
- `VIEW_CHANNEL`
- `READ_MESSAGES` **(deprecated)**
- `SEND_MESSAGES`
- `SEND_TTS_MESSAGES`
- `MANAGE_MESSAGES` (delete messages and reactions)
- `EMBED_LINKS` (links posted will have a preview embedded)
- `ATTACH_FILES`
- `READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY` (view messages that were posted prior to opening Discord)
- `MENTION_EVERYONE`
- `USE_EXTERNAL_EMOJIS` (use emojis from different guilds)
- `EXTERNAL_EMOJIS` **(deprecated)**
- `CONNECT` (connect to a voice channel)
- `SPEAK` (speak in a voice channel)
- `MUTE_MEMBERS` (mute members across all voice channels)
- `DEAFEN_MEMBERS` (deafen members across all voice channels)
- `MOVE_MEMBERS` (move members between voice channels)
- `USE_VAD` (use voice activity detection)
- `CHANGE_NICKNAME`
- `MANAGE_NICKNAMES` (change other members' nicknames)
- `MANAGE_ROLES`
- `MANAGE_ROLES_OR_PERMISSIONS` **(deprecated)**
- `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS`
- `MANAGE_EMOJIS`

props.name: ALL
props.description: Bitfield representing every permission combined

props.name: DEFAULT
props.description: Bitfield representing the default permissions for users

methods.name: has
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a permission, or multiple permissions.

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description: Whether to allow the administrator permission to override

methods.name: missing
methods.description: Gets all given permissions that are missing from the bitfield.

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description: Whether to allow the administrator permission to override

methods.name: add
methods.description: Adds permissions to this one, creating a new instance to represent the new bitfield.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes permissions to this one, creating a new instance to represent the new bitfield.

methods.name: serialize
methods.description:
Gets an object mapping permission name (like `VIEW_CHANNEL`) to a {@link boolean} indicating whether the
permission is available.

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description: Whether to allow the administrator permission to override

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Checks whether the user has a certain permission, e.g. `READ_MESSAGES`.

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the user to explicitly have the exact permission

methods.name: hasPermissions
methods.description: Checks whether the user has all specified permissions.

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the user to explicitly have the exact permissions

methods.name: missingPermissions
methods.description: Checks whether the user has all specified permissions, and lists any missing permissions.

params.name: explicit
params.description: Whether to require the user to explicitly have the exact permissions

methods.name: toArray
methods.description: Gets an {@link Array} of permission names (such as `VIEW_CHANNEL`) based on the permissions available.

params.name: checkAdmin
params.description: Whether to allow the administrator permission to override

methods.name: freeze
methods.description: Freezes these permissions, making them immutable.

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Resolves permissions to their numeric form.

classes.name: EvaluatedPermissions
classes.description: The final evaluated permissions for a member in a channel

Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>

Can be a Hex Literal, Hex String, Number, RGB Array, or one of the following

  'GREEN',
  'BLUE',
  'PURPLE',
  'LUMINOUS_VIVID_PINK',
  'GOLD',
  'ORANGE',
  'RED',
  'GREY',
  'DARKER_GREY',
  'NAVY',
  'DARK_AQUA',
  'DARK_GREEN',
  'DARK_BLUE',
  'DARK_PURPLE',
  'DARK_VIVID_PINK',
  'DARK_GOLD',

  'DARK_RED',

]

props.description: One of `user`, `bot`, `webhook`, or add `-` to negate (e.g. `-webhook`)

props.name: sortBy
props.description: `recent` or `relevant`

props.name: sortOrder
props.description: `asc` or `desc`

props.name: contextSize
props.description: How many messages to get around the matched message (0 to 2)

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of results to get (1 to 25)

props.name: offset
props.description: Offset the "pages" of results (since you can only see 25 at a time)

props.name: mentions
props.description: Mentioned user filter

props.name: mentionsEveryone
props.description: If everyone is mentioned

props.name: linkHostname
props.description: Filter links by hostname

props.name: embedProvider
props.description: The name of an embed provider

props.name: embedType
props.description: one of `image`, `video`, `url`, `rich`

props.name: attachmentFilename
props.description: The name of an attachment

props.name: attachmentExtension
props.description: The extension of an attachment

props.name: before
props.description: Date to find messages before

props.name: after
props.description: Date to find messages before

props.name: during
props.description: Date to find messages during (range of date to date + 24 hours)

props.name: nsfw
props.description: Include results from NSFW channels

props.name: totalResults
props.description: Total result count

props.name: messages
props.description:
Array of message results
The message which has triggered the result will have the `hit` property set to `true`

typedefs.name: AwaitMessagesOptions

props.name: errors

typedefs.name: AwaitReactionsOptions
typedefs.description: An object containing the same properties as CollectorOptions, but a few more:

props.name: errors
props.description: Stop/end reasons that cause the promise to reject

typedefs.description: Options that can be passed into editMessage.

props.name: embed

props.name: code
props.description: Language for optional codeblock formatting to apply

props.name: max
props.description: The maximum amount of messages to process

props.name: maxMatches
props.description: The maximum amount of messages to collect

props.name: max
props.description: The maximum total amount of reactions to collect

props.name: maxEmojis
props.description: The maximum number of emojis to collect

props.name: maxUsers
props.description: The maximum number of users to react

typedefs.name: RoleData
typedefs.description: The data for a role.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the role

props.name: color
props.description: The color of the role, either a hex string or a base 10 number

props.name: hoist
props.description: Whether or not the role should be hoisted

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the role

props.name: permissions
props.description: The permissions of the role

props.name: mentionable
props.description: Whether or not the role should be mentionable

typedefs.name: WebhookMessageOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed into send, sendMessage, sendFile, sendEmbed, and sendCode.

props.name: username
props.description: Username override for the message

props.name: avatarURL
props.description: Avatar URL override for the message

props.name: tts
props.description: Whether or not the message should be spoken aloud

props.name: nonce
props.description: The nonce for the message

props.name: embeds
props.description:
An array of embeds for the message
(see [here](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-object) for more details)

props.name: disableEveryone
props.description:
Whether or not @everyone and @here
should be replaced with plain-text

props.name: file
props.description: A file to send with the message **(deprecated)**

props.name: files
props.description: Files to send with the message

props.name: code
props.description: Language for optional codeblock formatting to apply

props.name: split
props.description:
Whether or not the message should be split into multiple messages if
it exceeds the character limit. If an object is provided, these are the options for splitting the message.

typedefs.name: ClientOptions
typedefs.description: Options for a client.

props.name: apiRequestMethod
props.description:
One of `sequential` or `burst`. The sequential handler executes
all requests in the order they are triggered, whereas the burst handler runs multiple in parallel, and doesn't
provide the guarantee of any particular order. Burst mode is more likely to hit a 429 ratelimit error by its nature,
and is therefore slightly riskier to use.

props.name: shardId
props.description: ID of the shard to run

props.name: shardCount
props.description: Total number of shards

props.name: messageCacheMaxSize
props.description:
Maximum number of messages to cache per channel
(-1 or Infinity for unlimited - don't do this without message sweeping, otherwise memory usage will climb
indefinitely)

props.name: messageCacheLifetime
props.description:
How long a message should stay in the cache until it is considered
sweepable (in seconds, 0 for forever)

props.name: messageSweepInterval
props.description:
How frequently to remove messages from the cache that are older than
the message cache lifetime (in seconds, 0 for never)

props.name: fetchAllMembers
props.description:
Whether to cache all guild members and users upon startup, as well as
upon joining a guild (should be avoided whenever possible)

props.name: disableEveryone
props.description: Default value for {@link MessageOptions#disableEveryone}

props.name: sync
props.description: Whether to periodically sync guilds (for user accounts)

props.name: restWsBridgeTimeout
props.description:
Maximum time permitted between REST responses and their
corresponding websocket events

props.name: restTimeOffset
props.description:
Extra time in millseconds to wait before continuing to make REST
requests (higher values will reduce rate-limiting errors on bad connections)

props.name: retryLimit
props.description:
How many times to retry on 5XX errors
(Infinity for indefinite amount of retries)

props.name: disabledEvents
props.description:
An array of disabled websocket events. Events in this array will not be
processed, potentially resulting in performance improvements for larger bots. Only disable events you are
100% certain you don't need, as many are important, but not obviously so. The safest one to disable with the
most impact is typically `TYPING_START`.

props.name: ws
props.description: Options for the WebSocket

props.name: http
props.description: HTTP options

typedefs.name: WebsocketOptions
typedefs.description: WebSocket options (these are left as snake_case to match the API)

props.name: large_threshold
props.description: Number of members in a guild to be considered large

props.name: compress
props.description:
Whether to compress data sent on the connection
(defaults to `false` for browsers)

typedefs.description: HTTP options

props.description: Base url of the API

props.name: cdn
props.description: Base url of the CDN

props.name: invite
props.description: Base url of invites

The current status of the client. Here are the available statuses:

* RECONNECTING: 2
* IDLE: 3
* NEARLY: 4
* DISCONNECTED: 5

typedefs.name: Snowflake
typedefs.description:
A Twitter snowflake, except the epoch is 2015-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
```
If we have a snowflake '266241948824764416' we can represent it as binary:

64                                          22     17     12          0
 000000111011000111100001101001000101000000  00001  00000  000000000000
      number of ms since Discord epoch       worker  pid    increment
```
